content: Is it just me, or does the background color and/or opacity for the message view in private messages feel a little off?
(In night mode only)
@Wyatt Hoodes what about it feels off to you?

It's hard to put my finger on exactly. I compared with the light theme, and the view felt much more subtle. When going back to night mode, the contrast feels a bit harsher and I find myself slightly straining to read the text. (Comparing to the light theme made me think more towards an opacity type condition.)
I might be alone here, but thought it was worth mentioning :)
I think we are using the same color in both modes, so very possible the night mode choice isn't correct.

For all grayscale colors night_bg < night_pm_bg < day_pm_bg < day_bg, there exists an rgba color that produces night_pm_bg when drawn on night_bg and produces day_pm_bg when drawn on day_bg, so it’s not really meaningful to say that we’re using the same color in both modes.
Yeah, that's fair.
I see. Then I guess my suggestion is night_pm_bg should be reduced. Which is a pretty big suggestion I suppose.
yeah, I agree; good catch!
Someone want to make a proposal for a new night_pm_bg value?

My suggestion design-wise, is to never actually have the background change, just a border in front of the message. Similar color, but just 5-10px wide thing. That makes the message list look more clean, less busy.
That includes all types of views and messages, both for default and night mode.
border in front meaning on the left side, or somewhere else?
Yeah, where the stream border is for stream messages.

It's an interesting idea. The reason we do the different background color is to make PMs stand out visually, so if that achieves that goal without creating other problems, it could be worth playing with.

What would you recommend for the unread marker, in that case?
I agree not having to have a separate color here would be nice.
Should I open an issue to track this?
yeah, for the time being I think fixing the color is probably best.
Opened #12467 :)
